Where to put a comma? I've always thought that the guide is, when you recite a text, it is where you pause "naturally". That's why I put a comma right after a "Though" that begins a line of my poem: "Though, I've heard . . ." (Wrong?) #writing #grammar

The Small Bang Theory

Because something invisible, small, & fragile
was terrorized by the prospect
of perpetual invisibility, smallness, & fragility
that it writhed & whimpered
then popped & expanded exponentially
into our universe as we (don't) know it. 

#writing #poetry

Tough Guy

I've been so good 
at faking it
that lately 
my reflection cries 
in lieu of me.
You'd think my mirror's
the exterior
of a windowpane
on a rainy night,
every night.

Dawn Barely Breaking

Horizon’s first fissure,
slightest parting 
of virgin lips.
Tongues of softest light 
uncurl, flick 
from ocean’s mouth.

4) . . .  if they’ll inform me that it's with them. I believe I signed it with “K. SEVILLA ‘91” as I created it around that year. It also belonged to my set of paintings that won for me a Jose Joya  Award in 1991. Advanced thanks to everyone who’ll try and/or could help!

3) . . . around 2006 (?). Eventually, they changed their interior design and removed the painting; I inquired about it but nobody could tell me where it was. If it's still intact and some people keep it, they can have it for life – but I will really appreciate it . . .

2) . . .  It’s a small still-life oil painting of white flowers in a vase on a wooden table, it has a green background and there’s a hammer in the foreground. I lent it to Friuli Trattoria and they used to display it on the wall of their first branch along Maginhawa St., QC 🇵🇭 .

Ka Leody naman, alam mo namang kinakabahang makipagdebate si Bongbong kaya nga minsan lang kung pumayag . . . tapos ikaw pa ang makakatapat! Mabuhay ka, Ka Leody, na matagal ko ring nakasama sa maraming pagkilos simula pa noong dekada nobenta! Para sa uring manggagawa! ✊

Unahin mo kasing sabihin ang, 
"Nagsisisi na kami at ibabalik ko na,"

Even Perfection is Subject to Misinterpretation

Your words fall perfectly into place . . .
And were they ever out of place
like my heart that has fallen
for one who'll never fall
for me?

"Friends and former friends died one after another, like ears of corn withering in a drought." - Haruki Murakami

Murakami might as well have written about this current pandemic, with these words from his short story, "New York Mining Disaster" -- penned circa 1980 - '81.

Maligalig Pa Rin

Pinili mo kasing manahimik,
ngunit ang katahimikan
ay di ka naman 
pinili pabalik.

No Duality

There is no thin line that divides at all:
The "opposites" always wildly brawl;
the grey area is the whole -- 
and both sides shall fall.

The Serious Worker

My happiness
is a serving of wine
in a stem glass
held by an unsteady hand
that is not even mine
because my hands labor
and whatever moves
or stills my heart
is a mere byproduct
or involuntary chemical reaction —
a trifle unlike my exertions
and actions.

In Gratitude

I write not because I have
something to prove,
but because I have
something to share.
And if for a fleeting moment
my small words
become to you what the rose
was to the little prince,
then thank you,
and you're welcome! 🌹
+ + +
Merry Christmas!🎄
(We will survive.)

Splash! 

Above, 
the hemp rope that dangles
and tests your grip 
morphs into a dagger blade.

Below, 
the perfect blue spring thirsts 
not for its cool tasteless water
but for fluid of warm rust.

It screams for contrast
to shatter its monochrome.

Dye it.

to the hypnosis 
of the ostinato
from the unseen
piano.

Lift up your face and gaze
at the tapestry of the night sky.

without realizing they’re as many as my scars.

A Meditation

Let yourself be still
until you’re cold steel.
Breathe, let your mind go,
and sense your warm blood flow.
Unreel and feel how you are so real.

years before she met me,

through deep forests & dark alleys.

for this fearless woman
retroactively.)

Is it a manifestation of, a form of, an extension of, narcissism when you fall in love with your own poem? This quirky and popular literary magazine has just sent the galley proof the other day, and every time I read/look at my concrete poem, I want to bend on one knee and . . .

Pilipino ako!
Basta kaprobinsya o karehiyon ko,
aking iboboto --
kahit siya'y asal-aso!
Ano ngayon kung ang ibang mga Pilipino
ay kanyang ginagago!?
Basta ang alam ko,
kapag siya'y nanalo,
dito sa aming dako,
ay araw-araw magiging Pasko!

I Implore

Of course,
I don’t want 
to be alone.
Otherwise,
why would I
say it?
Why would I
sing about
my loneliness --
if not for
the fading hope
that a breeze
will pick up
and carry 
my lament 
along 
a lonely journey 
until it finds you
in his arms?

Squid Game, Philippine elections version:

Ang unang laro ay COC filing. Ang sinumang mag-file para tumakbong presidente tapos aatras lang pala sa kinalaunan para palitan ng iba ay . . . 🦑

I believe the short poem "went" this way:

If by fate or by choice
I'll fall into your ocean again,
I'll keep my arms crossed:

to vanish without a trace,
not a single stroke to surface.

Down, drown, down I'll go
until I'm forever nestled
in your bosom.

Betrayed

The needle of my compass
goes round and round
and as fast as the gales
that sweep me.
The wind vanes are all broken
and the torn roofs 
fly and swirl.
I’m headed somewhere
but I’m going nowhere.
Thrust from the confession,
and into the red eye
of this storm.

To My Child Recently Diagnosed with Schizophrenia

If God mercifully grants me the power to heal
and lets me in your head, all those voices I'll kill.
Or if She/He/They shall order me to kneel 
before those voices to plead them to leave, I will.

For the nth time, on YouTube I watch Art Garfunkel . . .

Kathy's Song

He sings the song
as softest rain,
as a tiny bud 
secretly unfolds
in darkest night
to greet the dawn
in full bloom,
in a voice that mourns
more than it sings —
a dew that shivers
and descends
a leaf.

The Holy Harakiri Before the Altar

The steel that holds
the dome and walls
of this cathedral
that shelters me,
is the same steel
that makes the blade
of the knife I raise 
to the left of me.

If there's something wrong with my car, I'll have it checked by a car mechanic.

If I feel sick, I see the doctor.

And if I wonder about the state of our planet Earth, I listen to what the environmental scientists have to say.

And buckle up, humanity; we got serious work to do.

A Short Aubade

Lying on the grass,
beneath a tree,
I look up and see
a shimmer of sunlight, 
light,
twinkle, blink,
through the leaves.
It whispers, 
"Look around you;
I have conquered.
And tomorrow,
I'll be back."

And now, in one tweet: my punctuation-allergic poem. 🔥 #writing #poetry #writer #poetrycommunity #WritingCommunity https://t.co/fp9CnpxUfq

combustible vegetation
of 
parched forest
the final destination
of the buzzard
which carried
its unholy charge
in kamikaze spiral
with the fire feather
in its beak
plucked from the sun
which warmth
quickly seared
into harm

charred remains

that summer day
he mistook for comfort
the warmth
of the still-rising
temperature
and thought as dove
the buzzard
that circled above
and slowed down
to saunter
in his attempt
to leave the forest
of 
combustible vegetation

Reasons for Being

If I'm not crazy for love,
then what's all this madness for?
And if it's not over you,
then may this be over soon.

On the Brink

The janitor of the theater
mops the stage and sings
to empty seats of no applause.
But he's gifted with a golden voice.
And tomorrow, he'll make the choice.

From Selfies to Self-portrait

After a million taps,
she picks up
a pencil and draws
her reflection
for the first time.

the giant leap
from self-indulgence
to art.

Traditional rhymer: I'll have four shrubs and I want each one abloom with flowers.
Free verser: Let's cut and throw away the three others, and just a flower or two on that one shrub.

@EMCWritesPoetry Well, I don't follow a system myself, haha! I think just be very discerning when you need to take a break* or change of pace when necessary. Never good getting too stressed over our inextinguishable passion for literature and all that it entails. 🙂

*And I mean, temporary. 👍
@EMCWritesPoetry And yes, maybe it's a cyclical thing. 🙂

@EMCWritesPoetry I'm not sure if this will work for you, and I'm really very disorganized and just keep writing and submitting as often as I can: Perhaps try to spend all weekdays writing, then all weekends submitting (and still writing?). Just remember submission deadlines that fall on weekdays!

@EMCWritesPoetry I'm just high on the whole process! And I can honestly say that I've been numb to rejections. And this attitude has carried over to my current job hunt. Recently, my wife asked how I felt about another rejection from a company. I replied, "I'm just fine!" (She didn't like it.😅)

The Tightrope

Suspended above the absence
of a safety net,
between the sound of silence
and sirens.

Last year, my pandemic poem about the imposition of the lockdown was published in Philippines Graphic's 3/30 - 4/6, 2020 issue. Then, this April 4, another pandemic poem of mine will be published in Dissident Voice. So I got the first year of our lockdown covered -- end to end. https://t.co/t6iiDTC7mo

Imagine that 1) your government is able to construct a huge underground bunker that can accommodate and protect all its citizens in case of war. And then 2) a foreign country invades yours with bomber planes.

Guess who'll insist, "It's our right to stay outside and walk...!" 😷

There's romance watching bands perform in an evening concert -- outdoors and under pouring rain. Music fills the air as the performers get soaked along with their instruments and enraptured audience.

And not one among the wet crowd dares pull out a cellphone to video record.🌧️📱
@blackboughpoems Maligayang Kaarawan, Black Bough Poetry! 🎂 And I hope EIC Matt gets treatment for his eyes soon, and regain normal vision -- with or without eyeglasses. (Hopefully, the latter. 👁️)

This happened to me:

I have two poems first published, separately, in two different literary magazines that went defunct, unavailable somewhere in Internet limbo for months. (Or even a year?)

So I resubmitted and got these poems published again...

My April Fool's Day questions:

If a literary magazine goes defunct, unavailable and lost somewhere in Internet limbo for months, then reappears (though not necessarily publishing new material), do we call it formerly defunct? Or still defunct but available? #writing #poetry ✍️📜

People in the Rain

The colors of their clothes 
turn to pastel, pale.
The downpour heavier,
and they all blur 
with their parasols
into grey under
the crescendo
of the acoustic 
drum of rain.

Dear #writers and #translators,

I intend to translate a poem by a deceased poet, and submit my #translation for publication. Should I still ask permission from his estate? Or whoever holds the rights to his works?

Thanks in advance!🙂

Missing You

Cold as murder,
every piece of the debris.
But why do I still burn
with each touch of a memory?

Break

My coffee lasts an hour.
Hot to cold
as the seasons
of this archipelago.
My morning break 
from all this madness.
The longer the safer for me.
Time is a social construct.
Caffeine is real.
I'll take another one
this grey afternoon.

I'm considering climbing 
free solo to higher ground,
but my heart 
or some evil spirit
tempts me 
to follow my desires.

but I want to believe 
that the higher I reach,
and the deeper I fall,
the nobler I'll be.
And my indecision
is killing me.

Forever Fear

I am afraid to stay in…
So I decide to leave
for a few years.
A decade, even.
Yet I’m still afraid
that through it all,
I’ll still remember.
But am I not 
more afraid to forget?
Should I fear or fear not
that when I return
I am still in…?

I don't really get the, er, "coyness"?

A carpenter, who builds houses that last centuries or collapse the day after, calls himself a carpenter.

An actor, good or bad, calls himself an actor.

Then we have some poets who win awards and get published here and there and yet say, "I don't really consider myself a poet."

in an hour or two.

to our end,

this last suspension
of our disbelief
is enough
defiance. ✊

CW: Child Abuse 

My poem published @AwakeningsArt: https://t.co/egjxpKWIhn. 

Those were horrible crimes and stirred terrible memories in me. Also, no doubt he's an accomplished poet and continues to write. But where's the proper venue for his poems now? His private DOC file?

From one extreme
to the other.
This will all settle
somewhere between
the two ends.
Doesn't have to be
exactly or near the middle.
Most probably nearer
to one or the other.
I won't take part
in the conversation,
even though I'm the subject's
victim many times over.
But someday..

"I recall the yellow cotton dress
Foaming like a wave
On the ground around your knees...Oh no."

Final version:

Vivid Realizations

I only realized
the depth of my thirst
when I started to drink
and was surprised 
by mouthful gulps.

Same with my anger:
I only wanted 
to say my piece;
now even the walls
tremble in fear.

#amwriting #poetry #poem  #WritingCommunity #writer

Not a poem, but an aphorism:

Indecision is a sign of lingering dishonesty with oneself.

A revision:

Vivid Realizations

You'll never know
the depth of your thirst
until you start to drink
and be surprised 
by your mouthful gulps.

Same with anger:
I only wanted 
to say my piece;
now even the walls
tremble in fear.

#writing #poetry #poem #WritingCommunity

Vivid Realizations

You'll never know
how thirsty you are
until you start to drink
and be surprised 
by your mouthful gulps.

Same with anger:
I only wanted 
to say my piece;
now even the walls
tremble in fear.

When sun sets, we return home.

when the world darkens
and the street lamps 
in stark contrast stalk,
in resistance armed 
with incipient neon glow?

(Inspired by a scene from "Watchmen.") #amwriting #poetry ✍️ https://t.co/aRs4BL5D9E

Online #Litmag Went Defunct

Now lost in Internet limbo
along with my poems.
(Didn't even send an email
to notify.)

Submission wasn't by email.
Nor by Submittable.
They had their own 
submission system.
And I don't have the poems 
on file.

I wallow in the #poetry 
of this loss.

#depression is,

at times, struggling
to sleep;

at times, struggling 
against it.

At lahat ay karapat-dapat sa kapatawaran, at hinihiling ko sa presidente ng Estados Unidos na bigyan ako ng kapatawaran.”

Asa ka pa. Sa totoo lang, kung papanoorin natin ang mga balita, hindi totoo na si Jenna ay naging masunuri’t maamong tupa.

Nais ko ng kapatawaran (pardon) mula sa presidente ng Estados Unidos. Sa tingin ko lahat kami ay nararapat sa kapatawaran. Nahaharap ako na masentensyahan sa preso. Tingin ko di karapat-dapat sa akin yun. At ang bawat tao…sa pagkakaintindi ko lahat na narororoon ay aarestuhin.

nagtatangkang gumawa ng kahit anong karahasan, at di ko napagtanto na magkakaroon ng karahasan. Pero lumaki sa proporsyon ang mga kaganapan. Gusto ko humingi ng tawad sa lahat ng mga naapektuhang pamilya ng anumang negatibong kaligiran.

Kaya sa puso ng puso ko, pakiramdam ko ba ay ako ay kriminal? Hindi. Hindi ako ang kontrabida na pinapalabas ng maraming tao, o na iniisip nila dahil taga-suporta ako ni Trump. Pinapakita ko ang aking pagiging makabayan noong nandoon ako. Nagpoprotesta lamang ako, at di ako

ginagawa ko noon. SINUSUNOD KO ANG AKING PRESIDENTE. Sa isip ko ay sinusunod ko ang panawagan para sa kung ano ang dapat naming gawin. HUMILING SIYA SA AMIN NA LUMIPAD PATUNGO DOON, HUMILING SIYA SA AMIN NA PUMUNTA DOON. Ginawa ko ang kanyang hiniling na gawin daw namin.

Pakiramdam ko ba na ako’y may kasalanan? Hindi. Pero medyo nararamdaman ko na ako ay medyo naatraso sa sitwasyon. Ang masasabi ko ay ginagampanan ko noon ang aking makabayang tungkulin. Ako, sa personal, ay walang nararamdamang kahihiyan o pagkakasala sa aking puso dahil sa

pagsunod sa kanyang presidente, sa pagsama sa pag-atake sa US Capitol. Ito ang kanyang salaysay sa isang panayam sa CBS 11, ika-16 ng Enero, 2021 (sinalin ko mula sa Ingles, all caps mine): “Nahaharap ako na masentensyahan sa preso. Pakiramdam ko ba na ako ay kriminal? Hindi.

Indecisiveness is excruciating.

Every opening, a wound:

Your eyes, twin wounds
to see earth and sky.

Your ears, opposite wounds
to hear angels sing.

Your mouth, singular wound
to taste sweet wine.

(And your eyes wound me
with their beauty.)

How everything whirls, 
winds, wounds
me.

#writing #poetry

RT @Matt_Stefon: Retweeting this because I'm a bit worried about being able to make rent thsi month. I know I'm gonna be late--the question…

Night Lecture

Painstakingly, 
she points out
and explains
to me
each constellation
of what I knew 
all along
as nothing more
than random 
scattered stars.
I appreciate
the mythology.
Still, my secret reality
is that all the stars
I'll ever need 
are the eyes
she sets
on me.
